metridoc.core
[Groovy] Class MetridocJob

java.lang.Object
  metridoc.core.tools.DefaultTool
      metridoc.core.tools.RunnableTool
          metridoc.core.MetridocJob

abstract class MetridocJob
extends metridoc.core.tools.RunnableTool

This is the primary class used for running MetriDoc jobs. Although unnecessary to actually create a periodic job, it contains helpful methods for routing and profiling tasks, in addition to common triggers.

Field Summary
boolean concurrent

all metridoc jobs are not concurrent by default.

Field Detail

concurrent

public final boolean concurrent
all metridoc jobs are not concurrent by default. Any needed concurrency should be incorporated into the job itself. This basically provides a hint to quartz

jobLogger

private static final java.lang.Object jobLogger

 
Property Detail

MANUAL_RUN_TRIGGER

static final java.lang.Object MANUAL_RUN_TRIGGER
This was used when we couldn't manually set triggers in the web application. This is no longer needed and might be removed in newer versions of the core. Unfortunately for quartz to actually register a job, it must have some fire time in the future. This trigger has an arbitrarily long start up delay (50 years). By doing this the job can be managed via the quartzscheduler.
deprecated:

MIDNIGHT

static final java.lang.Object MIDNIGHT
represents a midnight trigger. Here for convenience when scheduling jobs in code

runRoute

java.lang.Object runRoute(groovy.lang.Closure closure)
runs the closure as a route within the metridoc.camel.GroovyRouteBuilder. Really handy for database migrations and batch processing
Parameters:
closure
Returns:

runRoute

java.lang.Object runRoute(org.apache.camel.builder.RouteBuilder builder)
instead of using runRoute with a closure, you can pass a RouteBuilder instead. This can be convenient if someone wants to use their own org.apache.camel.builder.RouteBuilder or wants to benefit from code completion
Parameters:
builder
